intro: Marcgravia stenonectaria, commonly known as the showy mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant belonging to the family Marcgraviaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, where it grows on the branches of trees such as palms and ceiba. The plant has small, elliptical leaves and produces fragrant, white or pale yellow flowers that attract insects for pollination. Its fruits are small berries that contain seeds dispersed by birds. Marcgravia stenonectaria plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food for wildlife and contributing to the biodiversity of its habitat.
